job_title: Assistant Manager in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Pretty great company to work for. Flexible hours.
cons: Non profit, so not as competitive pay as other industries.

job_title: Collection Technician in Saint Paul, MN
pros: (2015) Great training program, structure, and resources perfect for entry level or first time healthcare experience.  Patient / donor care experience.  Opportunities for growth, clear paths for growth.  Open communication at all levels of management.  Invested in keeping responsible / experienced people, promoting from within.  This job always felt meaningful, it was communicated frequently to technicians and donors the impact this service provides at the societal and individual level.
cons: All my cons are either minor or you should just expect from most work places.  Some "clutter" in requesting time off through HR or having to swap weekends, but really that just takes some getting used to.  Variable shifts doesn't always equate to flexible, depends on your requests (reasonable).  Personality is big depending on what team you're assigned to, I was fortunate to have been placed with a team that was a good fit for me.  The managers and op leads try to place according to fit, but business is business and sometimes you go where there's an opening, I witnessed some personality conflicts when this occurred, but most everybody kept things professional despite the "tension"

job_title: Laboratory Technician in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Work experience if you have none, good place to figure out exactly what kind of work environment you want to avoid. Free coffee.
cons: If you get stuck working weekends, good luck getting one off. Actually the PTO policy in general was terrible. Management does not truly care about the techs or the unequal work load. Literally incapable of listening to the techs that are actually on shift doing the work, just created more stress for them. If you are a good worker more will always be expected from you while the slackers continue to get praised for doing the bare minimum. Training is an absolute joke, the veteran techs do a much better job training (while getting paid less) than the "training specialists." Upper management is overall poor and clueless. Pay isn't very competitive and they will put promotions on hold.  Manager would state that they didn't have time to take a look at how much each shift is actually doing and it got to the point that techs were not allowed to voice concerns at meetings. I liked the work, but management did not make it worthwhile to stay.

review_title: Great people with a good mission
job_title: IT Professional in Saint Paul, MN
pros:
The people across all departments are solid and committed to the mission of saving lives.
The focus on the Donor Experience really helps personalize and humanize each and every visit.
cons:
Employee quality of life has significantly dropped since the merger with New York Blood center with New York and Kansas City making the majority of decisions for departments remotely.
Great people of all roles with commitment to the mission have been systemically weeded out, their positions leaving a gaping need for 6+ months at a time.

Tech projects and purchases specifically go through a process of planning, projection, and cost assessment by reporting to Kansas City. Feedback returns within a week or two to make changes. Once Kansas City okays the project it is sent to New York where it sits for an average of 3 months before being reviewed and change suggestions made and the process begins again.
This was for a printer purchase, larger projects take significantly longer to initiate.

job_title: QRA Specialist in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Opportunities to move up in company which is what I did. Lots of chances for continuing education. I felt very supported by my manager in every aspect of my job despite some of the cons. The mission of the organization made me feel good about the work that we do. Good work/life balance in my position.
cons:
Many members of management get away with extremely poor soft skills due to the results or perceived results they produce.  Tiptoeing around people's foul moods and their unwillingness to cooperate with others leads to lengthy delays in projects. We merged with another blood center 3 years ago and are far from operational processes actually being merged which is very frustrating.
This is a non-profit organization so don't think you're going to get super-rich working here. That's not necessarily a con but a complaint I'd often hear.

review_title: Needs to look at itself and make serious changes
job_title: in Saint Paul, MN
pros: MBC has some really great people working for the company and they do save lives.  I personally had a supportive manager who gave me a good work/life balance and provided autonomy.
cons: Due to changes in the industry many positions are eliminated and extra work is put on those who remain.  My job description was changed after I started working there and although I enjoyed what I did, it was not challenging enough to remain long-term.  There are too many egos to contend with to get a job done right the first time and too many people in positions they are not good at simply because of favoritism.

review_title: Not the best choice for work if you have any amount of integrity.
job_title: Mid Management in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Great co-workers for the most part. Kind and caring people doing the best they can in a very difficult environment.
cons: Advancement opportunity for the "IN" crowd only.  Values are only applicable to those not in control.  Do as I say does not always match regulatory requirements.  This is not a non-profit and should not be considered or categorized as such. CEO is left out of the loop when it comes to the treatment of his employees.  He is a nice guy but does not seem to know how his upper management functions. This company has saved many lives but cares little for the employees that have made this possible.  Harassing people does not make a better employee or product.

review_title: Sigh, this place is a hot mess.
job_title: Assistant Manager in Saint Paul, MN
pros: There are a lot of dedicated and reliable employees.  It's unfortunate that such good people are blindly putting faith in senior management and they are unwittingly being led to the slaughterhouse.
cons: This company is sinking fast. Senior leaders are abandoning ship left and right.  That's a not so subtle hint to put on a life vest.  In order to stay afloat, MBC has unfortunately prioritized profits over the quality of blood products.  They've neglected to implement industry known best practices and with such archaic processes in place, they're being left in the dust and it's no one's fault but their own.  Memorial Blood Centers is a great example of why it's important to be proactive opposed to reactive because they're disproportionately reactive.  That's not how great (or decent) businesses are run.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Paul, MN
pros:
Dedicated to community
Good manager, awesome supervisors and coworkers!
Dedicated to their quality, service, safety, and products! Will absolutely vouch for their products!
Good work environment, very positive atmosphere, especially among coworkers!
cons:
Upper management doesn't listen to labs about efficiency, policies and production (and almost everything it feels like).
There isn't as good interdepartmental relations as there could and should be. Talking about "treating coworkers as customers and providing them great customer service", isn't the same as actively fostering cordial interactions.
Opportunities for growth isn't exactly encouraged. People that have been there for years stifle newcomers, who may be more skilled and educated, but won't be given the chance to grow and increase their experience as well.

job_title: Customer Service in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Their Mission statement, The orientation is alot of information at once but helpful and the CEO starts out and seems very hands on with his position, but after you work awhile you see things more clear.
cons: All employees better print and save all correspondence, because you may need it at some point as I did, do not leave at work make sure you have a file at home. Your Attorney may need it.

job_title: Call Center Associate in Saint Paul, MN
pros:
I loved working independently and then as a team. The director is friendly and open to people from various backgrounds. They love what they do and their values are prominent. I wished there were more women in higher positions. 

They teach you to be an excellent caller and do not pressure if you don't make the daily amount of appointments for donors.  I enjoyed working there a lot!
cons: Short lunch break and strict rules if you break it. I was given a warning, I did not know it was that big of a deal. Sat. and Sun. make it hard for employees to get donors.

review_title: "Memorial Blood Centers - It's About Saving Lives" (except for those of the people who work here)
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Contributing to the nations blood supply needs and regulations is a very important role.  Overall, the employees are amazingly talented and passionate.
cons: Upper management has no concept of the time and other resources that are required for maintaining needs, even less for expanding them.  A result is woefully understaffed and overworked departments.  This may be manageable if there were other benefits to balance this out but upper management tactics vary from dismissive attitudes to outright verbal manipulation and abuse (even toward high level employees).

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Paul, MN
pros: There are a few good, kind and caring people employed; I have yet to figure out why they stay.
cons: As stated in the earlier review, save copies of correspondences.  Leadership and HR use scare tactics on employees they target, yes target. It doesn't matter how hard you work if you're not their ideal fit they will find a way to make you miserable and leave. Toxic environment.

review_title: Hostile work environment and poor leadership
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Paul, MN
pros: Dedicated frontline staff.  Outstanding mission.  Amazing volunteers!
cons: CEO is unaware of what is going on.  Leaders are leaving due to hostile environment and no one even asks why.  Integrity is not a value that is followed by certain leaders.  There is very sophomoric behavior in how some leaders speak to there staff.  Overheard one manager tell an employee that they looked like a "terd" when they came to work wearing all brown.  Who does that?  Synergy is lacking and passive aggressive behavior is fostered by certain VP's.  It's a mean girls club.

review_title: Mind-numbing Work in the Call Center
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Paul, MN
pros:
There are monthly bonuses you can make in the call center.
The work is easy and the work schedule is nice.
It's a non-profit organization, which attracts like-minded people.
Fixed working hours in the call center (20/week or 40/week).
Paid holidays (New Years, Memorial Day, Independence Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving, and Christmas) - paid double time if you work those days.
cons:
Call center jobs suck, in general. The mind-numbing repetitiveness will drive you insane. Part-timers and site reps work weekends and evenings.

Management is incredibly passive aggressive and all communication has to go through channels - you forward your concerns to the next tier up, they forward it on, etc etc. It's absolutely absurd and a waste of time.

The mission of serving the community gets lost and forgotten about - everything is about meeting goals and getting silly "rewards" if you do (like food). Call center staff are essentially treated like children - "If you do this, then we'll reward you with a treat!" It's degrading.

There is an extremely high turnover rate in all departments. If management is leaving left and right, it's probably not a good sign. Turnover rate in the call center itself is even higher. Many don't last more than a couple weeks. There's a lot of hires through temp agancies in the call center, so those who don't enjoy the job within the first couple days simply stop showing up without notice.

There is absolutely no opportunity for growth with in the organization. I would almost say that it is discouraged. All open positions are filled through external hires. Inter-department transfers is hard to do as there is a 1-year commitment policy to your department.

review_title: Highly Mission Oriented and Motivated Non-Profit
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Paul, MN
pros:
The people across all departments are fairly easy to work with and senior leadership makes a concerted effort to bridge communication gaps between the front lines and the very top. Most everyone is welcoming and that makes the job as painless as it can be to walk into in the morning. You often get the feeling that your colleagues and management really does care about you as a person.
At the end of the day you drink the kool aid and understand that your efforts really ARE going towards saving lives, and that means a lot when you come here from a fortune 500 company.
cons:
Depending on your department you either have an abundance of options to move your career forwards or you have absolutely nowhere to go to at all starting at ground zero.
The departments are lean and picking up the slack from colleagues can become trying, especially with the continuously floating several years long projects taking up focus across the company.
There seems to be a major lack of communication and accountability in the middle tier positions and it causes major productivity loss and project slowdowns, this is most evident in the more service oriented departments.
Though it is stressed and it is attempted every quarter, there is a complete and utter lack of a combined work culture.
Aside from the Call Center there is a distinct lack of cultural diversity across the entirety of the company.
In my role specifically there is a considerable lack of work/life balance and compensation.

job_title: Donor Testing in Saint Paul, MN
pros:
There are some really great people here. Some of the best people I’ve worked with
You feel like you’re helping people with your work and that you’re saving lives
cons:
There’s no trust between management and techs, any talk about changing a process is quickly forgotten by management. To compound that, management doesn’t seem know how everything works in the lab yet try to make changes that will make it “better” without listening to the people who do it day in and day out. If you’re not on first shift, no one listens to you.

There also is no room for advancement, I’ve watched positions open up and people who are qualified be passed over for external applicants every time. 

Training takes far too long because the trainers are not the people actually doing the job daily and they can’t even do the jobs they’re training for.

The metrics in place to track employees are ridiculous, currently the system makes low performing workers look good due to their lowered deviation count yet workers who actually do more work end up with more deviations because they’re simply doing a higher quantity of work and have more chances to make a mistake.

The pay is not competitive with jobs you can get with the requirements and the raises are paltry at best. The amount of stress involved in the job is far to high for the pay

There are compliance rules that do not make any sense, there’s no need to comply to EU standards.

job_title: in North Branch, MN
pros: MBC has a strong mission, it's easy to get behind.  There are great people who are fun to work with. MBC does its best to promote from within so it is a place that you can build a career.
cons: Needs more parking and limited lunch options.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Saint Paul, MN
pros: A good place to work if you have no education or experience
cons: Short lunch, long hours, donors feel harassed, you call the same numbers every week.Management is horrible often have open conversation about staff in front of other staff. CSR Management is rude if you ask for help or have a question often rolling there eyes but sounding polite very passive.  Not a positive work environment

job_title: Lab Tech in Saint Paul, MN
pros: You get to work for a company that has no idea what is going on.  How is that a pro you ask?  You get to do nothing all day, everyday and still get a paycheck!
cons: The biggest con is you have to sit back and watch good people get treated very poorly.  The hardest working people get the shortest end of the stick.  Additionally, you have to being willing to let go of all your morals and values because here at Memorial Blood Centers the focus is the bottom line.  The most emphasis is put on saving a buck, not saving lives.  Another con to working here is that the employee is anything but valued.  When ethical issues are brought to the attention of the CEO, they are ignored and swept under the rug in hopes that either the employee will leave or the issue will just "go away."  Also if you work here be prepared to continue to see "top dogs" quitting with not explanation.  In the past 3-4 months we have lost at least 5 and when the CEO is questioned about this, he explains it as, "Turn over happens sometimes."  I wish I did not have to continue working here, but I am stuck due to being in school.

review_title: It was a job I enjoyed for the most part.
job_title: Phlebotomist in Saint Paul, MN
pros: They train you at everything. Lots of room to advance. Will hire with no experience. pay increases are significant. Something new everyday.
cons: Won't work with you if you need days off or if you want to work part time. You can't be off work every day at a certain time unless you work at a center.

review_title: Poorly managed and disgruntled workforce that has a positive mission statement, but doesn't embrace it at all.
job_title: Manager in Saint Paul, MN
pros: There were a few people within the organization that seemed like the genuinely cared about their job and the people they worked with.
cons: Management was poor as there was a huge disconnect between what happens upstairs and what happens downstairs. Certain departments were worse than others, but it was unclear as to who was in charge at times, managers or disgruntled senior staff.

job_title: Asst Manager
pros: The only positive thing I can come up was that I did get paid on time and I did meet a few great people.
cons: Micromanagement, fear of new ideas, fear of new competent staff, disgruntled employees, senior leaders with no clue what they are doing, stagnant people that never want to evolve, passive-aggressive culture.... On and on it goes

job_title: Driver in Saint Paul, MN
pros: This company does help allot of people.
cons: The phlebs are immature, clicky and judgemental. Leads don't control their teams. Drivers work too long due to extremely poor leadership. And nobody knows how to fix these problems because overall leadership is lacking the skills to do this. Promotions are only given to friends, not the people that deserve it.

review_title: The Mission of this Company is to Save Lives, But the Top brass isn't aware of mid management decisions being made.
